dom-cssfontfacerule-style.name: style
dom-cssfontfacerule-style.summary: The read-only style property of the CSSFontFaceRule interface returns the style information from the @font-face at-rule. This will be in the form of a CSSStyleDeclaration object.
dom-cssfontfacerule-style.title: CSSFontFaceRule: style property

om-fontface.name: CSSFontFaceRule
om-fontface.summary: The CSSFontFaceRule interface represents an @font-face at-rule.
om-fontface.title: CSSFontFaceRule

dom-cssfontfeaturevaluesrule-fontfamily.name: fontFamily
dom-cssfontfeaturevaluesrule-fontfamily.summary: The fontFamily property of the CSSConditionRule interface represents the name of the font family it applies to.
dom-cssfontfeaturevaluesrule-fontfamily.title: CSSFontFeatureValuesRule: fontFamily property

cssfontfeaturevaluesrule.name: CSSFontFeatureValuesRule
cssfontfeaturevaluesrule.summary: The CSSFontFeatureValuesRule interface represents an @font-feature-values at-rule, letting developers assign for each font face a common name to specify features indices to be used in font-variant-alternates.
cssfontfeaturevaluesrule.title: CSSFontFeatureValuesRule

dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-basepalette.name: basePalette
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-basepalette.summary: The read-only basePalette property of the CSSFontPaletteValuesRule interface indicates the base palette associated with the rule.
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-basepalette.title: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule: basePalette property

dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-fontfamily.name: fontFamily
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-fontfamily.summary: The read-only fontFamily property of the CSSFontPaletteValuesRule interface lists the font families the rule can be applied to. The font families must be named families; generic families like courier are not valid.
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-fontfamily.title: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule: fontFamily property

dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-name.name: name
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-name.summary: The read-only name property of the CSSFontPaletteValuesRule interface represents the name identifying the associated @font-palette-values at-rule. A valid name always starts with two dashes, such as --Alternate.
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-name.title: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule: name property

dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-overridecol.name: overrideColors
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-overridecol.summary: The read-only overrideColors property of the CSSFontPaletteValuesRule interface is a string containing a list of color index and color pair that are to be used instead. It is specified in the same format as the corresponding override-colors descriptor.
dom-cssfontpalettevaluesrule-overridecol.title: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule: overrideColors property

om-fontpalettevalues.name: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule
om-fontpalettevalues.summary: The CSSFontPaletteValuesRule interface represents an @font-palette-values at-rule.
om-fontpalettevalues.title: CSSFontPaletteValuesRule

font-metrics-override-desc.name: ascent-override
font-metrics-override-desc.summary: The ascent-override CSS descriptor for the @font-face at-rule defines the ascent metric for the font. The ascent metric is the height above the baseline that CSS uses to lay out line boxes in an inline formatting context.
font-metrics-override-desc.title: ascent-override

font-metrics-override-desc.name: descent-override
font-metrics-override-desc.summary: The descent-override CSS descriptor for the @font-face at-rule defines the descent metric for the font. The descent metric is the height below the baseline that CSS uses to lay out line boxes in an inline formatting context.
font-metrics-override-desc.title: descent-override

font-metrics-override-desc.name: line-gap-override
font-metrics-override-desc.summary: The line-gap-override CSS descriptor for the @font-face at-rule defines the line-gap metric for the font. The line-gap metric is the font recommended line-gap or external leading.
font-metrics-override-desc.title: line-gap-override

font-display-desc.name: font-display
font-display-desc.summary: The font-display descriptor for the @font-face at-rule determines how a font face is displayed based on whether and when it is downloaded and ready to use.
font-display-desc.title: font-display

font-family-desc.name: font-family
font-family-desc.summary: The font-family CSS descriptor sets the font family for a font specified in an @font-face at-rule.
font-family-desc.title: font-family

font-rend-desc.name: font-feature-settings
font-rend-desc.summary: The font-feature-settings CSS descriptor allows you to define the initial settings to use for the font defined by the @font-face at-rule. You can further use this descriptor to control typographic font features such as ligatures, small caps, and swashes, for the font defined by @font-face. The values for this descriptor are the same as the font-feature-settings property, except for the global keyword values.

firefox.notes: The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition suggests using the ssty feature to provide glyph variants more suitable for use in scripts (for example primes used as superscripts). Starting with Firefox 29, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition also suggests applying the dtls feature to letters when placing mathematical accents to get dotless forms (for example dotless i, j with a hat). Starting with Firefox 35, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. You can override the default values determined by the MathML rendering engine with CSS.
From Firefox 4 to Firefox 14 (inclusive), Firefox supported an older, slightly different syntax. See OpenType Font Feature support in Firefox 4.

font-rend-desc.title: font-feature-settings

font-rend-desc.name: font-variation-settings
font-rend-desc.summary: The font-variation-settings CSS descriptor allows authors to specify low-level OpenType or TrueType font variations in the @font-face at-rule. The values for this descriptor are the same as the font-variation-settings property, except for the global keyword values.
font-rend-desc.title: font-variation-settings

font-prop-desc.name: font-stretch
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-stretch CSS descriptor allows authors to specify a normal, condensed, or expanded face for the fonts specified in the @font-face at-rule.
font-prop-desc.title: font-stretch

font-prop-desc.name: font-style
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-style CSS descriptor allows authors to specify font styles for the fonts specified in the @font-face at-rule.
font-prop-desc.title: font-style

font-prop-desc.name: font-weight
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-weight CSS descriptor allows authors to specify font weights for the fonts specified in the @font-face at-rule. The font-weight property can separately be used to set how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed.
font-prop-desc.title: font-weight

font-variant-prop.name: font-variant
font-variant-prop.summary: The @font-face CSS at-rule specifies a custom font with which to display text; the font can be loaded from either a remote server or a locally-installed font on the user's own computer.
font-variant-prop.title: @font-face

font-variant-prop.name: font-variant
font-variant-prop.summary: The font-variant CSS shorthand property allows you to set all the font variants for a font.
font-variant-prop.title: font-variant

font-variant-prop.name: font-variant
font-variant-prop.summary: The font-variant attribute indicates whether the text is to be rendered using variations of the font's glyphs.
font-variant-prop.title: font-variant

src-desc.name: src
src-desc.summary: The src CSS descriptor for the @font-face at-rule specifies the resource containing font data. It is required for the @font-face rule to be valid.
src-desc.title: src

unicode-range-desc.name: unicode-range
unicode-range-desc.summary: The unicode-range CSS descriptor sets the specific range of characters to be used from a font defined using the @font-face at-rule and made available for use on the current page. If the page doesn't use any character in this range, the font is not downloaded; if it uses at least one, the whole font is downloaded.
unicode-range-desc.title: unicode-range

font-face-rule.name: font-face
font-face-rule.summary: The @font-face CSS at-rule specifies a custom font with which to display text; the font can be loaded from either a remote server or a locally-installed font on the user's own computer.
font-face-rule.title: @font-face

font-feature-values.name: font-feature-values
font-feature-values.summary: The @font-feature-values CSS at-rule lets you use a common name in the font-variant-alternates property for features activated differently in OpenType. This can help simplify your CSS when using multiple fonts.
font-feature-values.title: @font-feature-values

at-ruledef-font-palette-values.name: font-palette-values
at-ruledef-font-palette-values.summary: The @font-palette-values CSS at-rule allows you to customize the default values of font-palette created by the font-maker.
at-ruledef-font-palette-values.title: @font-palette-values

generic-font-families.name: font-family
generic-font-families.summary: The font-family CSS property specifies a prioritized list of one or more font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.

firefox.notes: Not supported on option elements. See bug 1536148.

generic-font-families.title: font-family

generic-font-families.name: font-family
generic-font-families.summary: The font-family attribute indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names.
generic-font-families.title: font-family

font-family-prop.name: font-family
font-family-prop.summary: The font-family CSS property specifies a prioritized list of one or more font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.

firefox.notes: Not supported on option elements. See bug 1536148.

font-family-prop.title: font-family

font-family-prop.name: font-family
font-family-prop.summary: The font-family attribute indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names.
font-family-prop.title: font-family

font-feature-settings-prop.name: font-feature-settings
font-feature-settings-prop.summary: The font-feature-settings CSS property controls advanced typographic features in OpenType fonts.

firefox.notes: The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition suggests using the ssty feature to provide glyph variants more suitable for use in scripts (for example primes used as superscripts). Starting with Firefox 29, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition also suggests applying the dtls feature to letters when placing mathematical accents to get dotless forms (for example dotless i, j with a hat). Starting with Firefox 35, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. You can override the default values determined by the MathML rendering engine with CSS.
From Firefox 4 to Firefox 14 (inclusive), Firefox supported an older, slightly different syntax. See OpenType Font Feature support in Firefox 4.

font-feature-settings-prop.title: font-feature-settings

font-kerning-prop.name: font-kerning
font-kerning-prop.summary: The font-kerning CSS property sets the use of the kerning information stored in a font.
font-kerning-prop.title: font-kerning

font-language-override-prop.name: font-language-override
font-language-override-prop.summary: The font-language-override CSS property controls the use of language-specific glyphs in a typeface.
font-language-override-prop.title: font-language-override

font-optical-sizing-def.name: font-optical-sizing
font-optical-sizing-def.summary: The font-optical-sizing CSS property sets whether text rendering is optimized for viewing at different sizes.
font-optical-sizing-def.title: font-optical-sizing

font-palette-prop.name: font-palette
font-palette-prop.summary: The font-palette CSS property allows specifying one of the many palettes contained in a font that a user agent should use for the font. Users can also override the values in a palette or create a new palette by using the @font-palette-values at-rule.
font-palette-prop.title: font-palette

font-size-prop.name: font-size
font-size-prop.summary: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.
font-size-prop.title: font-size

font-size-prop.name: font-size
font-size-prop.summary: The font-size attribute refers to the size of the font from baseline to baseline when multiple lines of text are set solid in a multiline layout environment.
font-size-prop.title: font-size

font-stretch-prop.name: font-stretch
font-stretch-prop.summary: The font-stretch CSS property selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font.

chrome.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

edge_blink.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

font-stretch-prop.title: font-stretch

font-stretch-prop.name: font-stretch
font-stretch-prop.summary: The font-stretch attribute indicates the desired amount of condensing or expansion in the glyphs used to render the text.
font-stretch-prop.title: font-stretch

font-style-prop.name: font-style
font-style-prop.summary: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 44, oblique was not distinguished from italic.

font-style-prop.title: font-style

font-style-prop.name: font-style
font-style-prop.summary: The font-style attribute specifies whether the text is to be rendered using a normal, italic, or oblique face.
font-style-prop.title: font-style

font-synthesis-small-caps.name: font-synthesis-small-caps
font-synthesis-small-caps.summary: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property lets you specify whether or not the browser may synthesize small-caps typeface when it is missing in a font family. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.
font-synthesis-small-caps.title: font-synthesis-small-caps

font-synthesis-style.name: font-synthesis-style
font-synthesis-style.summary: The font-synthesis-style CSS property lets you specify whether or not the browser may synthesize the oblique typeface when it is missing in a font family.
font-synthesis-style.title: font-synthesis-style

font-synthesis-weight.name: font-synthesis-weight
font-synthesis-weight.summary: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property lets you specify whether or not the browser may synthesize the bold typeface when it is missing in a font family.
font-synthesis-weight.title: font-synthesis-weight

font-synthesis.name: font-synthesis
font-synthesis.summary: The font-synthesis shorthand CSS property lets you specify whether or not the browser may synthesize the bold, italic, and/or small-caps typefaces when they are missing in the specified font-family.
font-synthesis.title: font-synthesis

font-variant-alternates-prop.name: font-variant-alternates
font-variant-alternates-prop.summary: The font-variant-alternates CSS property controls the usage of alternate glyphs. These alternate glyphs may be referenced by alternative names defined in @font-feature-values.
font-variant-alternates-prop.title: font-variant-alternates

font-variant-caps-prop.name: font-variant-caps
font-variant-caps-prop.summary: The font-variant-caps CSS property controls the use of alternate glyphs for capital letters.
font-variant-caps-prop.title: font-variant-caps

font-variant-east-asian-prop.name: font-variant-east-asian
font-variant-east-asian-prop.summary: The font-variant-east-asian CSS property controls the use of alternate glyphs for East Asian scripts, like Japanese and Chinese.
font-variant-east-asian-prop.title: font-variant-east-asian

font-variant-emoji-prop.name: font-variant-emoji
font-variant-emoji-prop.summary: The font-variant-emoji CSS property specifies the default presentation style for displaying emojis.
font-variant-emoji-prop.title: font-variant-emoji

font-variant-emoji-prop.name: font-variant-emoji
font-variant-emoji-prop.summary: The font-variant-emoji CSS property specifies the default presentation style for displaying emojis.
font-variant-emoji-prop.title: font-variant-emoji

font-variant-ligatures-prop.name: font-variant-ligatures
font-variant-ligatures-prop.summary: The font-variant-ligatures CSS property controls which ligatures and contextual forms are used in textual content of the elements it applies to. This leads to more harmonized forms in the resulting text.
font-variant-ligatures-prop.title: font-variant-ligatures

font-variant-numeric-prop.name: font-variant-numeric
font-variant-numeric-prop.summary: The font-variant-numeric CSS property controls the usage of alternate glyphs for numbers, fractions, and ordinal markers.
font-variant-numeric-prop.title: font-variant-numeric

font-variant-position-prop.name: font-variant-position
font-variant-position-prop.summary: The font-variant-position CSS property controls the use of alternate, smaller glyphs that are positioned as superscript or subscript.
font-variant-position-prop.title: font-variant-position

font-variation-settings-def.name: font-variation-settings
font-variation-settings-def.summary: The font-variation-settings CSS property provides low-level control over variable font characteristics by letting you specify the four letter axis names of the characteristics you want to vary along with their values.

safari.notes: Requires macOS 10.13 High Sierra or later.

font-variation-settings-def.title: font-variation-settings

font-weight-prop.name: font-weight
font-weight-prop.summary: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.
font-weight-prop.title: font-weight

font-weight-prop.name: font-weight
font-weight-prop.summary: The font-weight attribute refers to the boldness or lightness of the glyphs used to render the text, relative to other fonts in the same font family.
font-weight-prop.title: font-weight

font-prop.name: font
font-prop.summary: The font CSS shorthand property sets all the different properties of an element's font. Alternatively, it sets an element's font to a system font.
font-prop.title: font

font-size-adjust-prop.name: font-size-adjust
font-size-adjust-prop.summary: The font-size-adjust attribute allows authors to specify an aspect value for an element that will preserve the x-height of the first choice font in a substitute font.
font-size-adjust-prop.title: font-size-adjust
